papers.title: Socialization in Open Source Software Projects: A Growth Mixture Modeling Approach
papers.relevance: Examines how socialization processes including mentorship lead to core developer status in OSS projects

semantic_scholar_match.title: Socialization in Open Source Software Projects: A Growth Mixture Modeling Approach

citations.reasoning: Multiple studies document how mentorship from core developers accelerates newcomer integration and promotion in OSS communities, supporting the reinforcing growth mechanism.

papers.title: Knowledge Collaboration in Online Communities
papers.authors: Faraj, S., Jarvenpaa, S. L., et al.
papers.relevance: Documents how knowledge transfer through mentoring increases collective capability and project velocity

citations.reasoning: Research consistently shows that knowledge transfer and skill development in OSS communities create virtuous cycles that amplify collective experience and development capacity.

papers.title: The Cathedral and the Bazaar
papers.relevance: Describes the natural hierarchy and promotion dynamics in OSS projects where core developers emerge from contributors

citations.reasoning: Multiple studies document the balancing effects of promotion systems in OSS, where advancement depletes the experienced contributor pool and creates natural equilibrium points.
